metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2232 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Group Replication Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.23 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 1.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored. mdeslaur> 8.x only

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.25-0ubuntu3').
